name: Jinyu Tian 0001
content: Tian - Homepage Jinyu Tian Macau University of Science and Technology Macau, China Email Github Google Scholar Jinyu Tian is currently an Assistant Professor at the Faculty of Innovation Engineering, at Macau University of Science and Technology. He received his Ph.D. degree from the Faculty of Science and Technology, University of Macau, Taipa, China. Before this, he received B.S. and M.S. degrees in mathematics from Chongqing University, Chongqing, China, in 2014 and 2017, respectively. His current research interests include adversarial machine learning, security of deep learning, and subspace learning. He has authored/co-authored over 10 scientific papers in international journals and conferences, such as TIP, TNNLS, AAAI, and CVPR. He is a regular reviewer of extensive journals and conferences, such as TIP, TMM, ACM MM, and CVPR. ğŸ“– EDUCATIONS 2017.08 - 2022.01 University of Macau, Macau, China, Ph.D., Computer Science. 2014.09 - 2017.07 Chongqing University, Chongqing, China, M.S., Mathematics. 2010.09 - 2014.07 Chongqing University, Chongqing, China, B.S., Mathematics. ğŸ’» RESEARCH INTERESTS/AREAS Adversarial Machine Learning: Adversarial Detection, White-box Attack, and Physical Attack. Security of Deep Learning: IP Protection of Deep Models, Watermarking of Deep Models. Multimedia Forensics: Forgery Detection, DeepFake Detection, AIGC Detection. Subspace Learning: Subspace Manifold Representation, Robust Subspace Learning. ğŸ“– OPENINGS We regularly have several positions for full-scholarship and half-scholarship Ph.D. If you are interested in my research and want to join our group, please donâ€™t hesitate to send me an email with your CV and research interests. ğŸ”¥ NEWS 2025.10: ğŸ‰ One papers is accepted by TCSVT 2024.11: ğŸ‰ Two papers are accepted by AAAI 2025 2024.10: ğŸ‰ One paper is accepted by NeruIPS 2024 ğŸ“ PUBLICATIONS 2025 Binze Wang, Jinyu Tian*, Xingrun Wang, Xiaochen Yuan, Jianqing Li, â€œReversible Unlearnable Examples: Towards the Copyright Protection in Deep Learning Eraâ€, IEEE Transactions on Circuits and Systems for Video Technology.
